problem_statement: Predict customer churn for an e-commerce business using historical transaction behavior to enable proactive retention strategies.

dataset.name: Online Retail II Dataset
dataset.granularity: Transactional data aggregated to customer level

churn_definition.definition: A customer is labeled as churned if they make no purchases within a 120-day observation window following the training cutoff date.

modeling.validation_strategy: Strict temporal split with 30% held-out validation set and stratified sampling.

business_impact.objective: Reduce customer churn through early identification of high-risk customers
business_impact.expected_benefit: Improved customer retention with high recall (77%), ensuring the majority of potential churners are captured for intervention.

key_learnings: Logistic Regression with balanced class weights provides a strong baseline and high recall
Threshold optimization is critical for balancing precision and recall in imbalanced churn data
Behavioral ratio features like monetary_per_txn provide significant predictive power
Model stability and high recall are more valuable for proactive retention than overall accuracy
challenges_faced: Optimizing thresholds to meet business requirements for recall
Handling class imbalance between active and churned customers
Maintaining feature consistency between training and deployment pipelines
Managing computational time for training more complex models like Neural Networks
